description: Region Events are emitted when a device enters or exits a geofence or the range of any of a set of bluetooth beacons. Region events require a Gimbal integration. Events for Gimbal customers include the Gimbal application instance identifer as `com.urbanairship.gimbal.aii` within the `identifiers` object.

action.description: Indicates whether the event was the result of a user entering or exiting the region.

name.description: A friendly name for the event; may be retrieved from a third-party.

region_id.description: The identifier for the region in Airship.

session_id.description: Represents the “session” of user activity. Absent if the application was initialized while backgrounded.
session_id.title: Session ID

source_info.description: Information about the source application that generated the event.

region_id.description: The unique region identifier from the originating system.

source.description: Identifies the system that the event originated from.

device.description: Information about app users generated by the SDK.

amazon_channel.description: The identifier for an Amazon channel. In general, this is also the same value as the "channel"

android_channel.description: The identifier for an Android channel. In general, this is also the same value as the "channel"

app_package_name.description: A unique identifier for the app name.

background_push_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not the device has background push notifications enabled.

carrier.description: The wireless carrier used by the device.

connection_type.description: The internet connection type used by the device.

iana_timezone.description: The time zone of the device.

locale_country_code.description: The ISO-3166-1 country code as defined in device settings.

locale_language_code.description: The ISO-639-1 two-letter language code reflecting the language that the device is set to.

locale_timezone.description: The device's timezone offset in seconds from UTC.

location_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not the device has location services enabled.

location_permission.description:
* `SYSTEM_LOCATION_DISABLED` Location is disabled in system settings
* `NOT_ALLOWED` Android: missing manifest permissions, iOS: opted out
* `ALWAYS_ALLOWED` Android: has manifest permissions, iOS: opted in background and foreground
* `FOREGROUND_ALLOWED` iOS only: opted in foreground only
* `UNPROMPTED`: iOS only

push_opt_in.description: Indicates whether or not the device is opted into push notifications.

ua_sdk_version.description: The version of the Airship SDK used in the app.

channel.description: The unique, platform-agnostic channel identifier for a device.

device_type.description: The platform that the channel is on.

identifiers.description: Identifying information specific to app devices.

com.urbanairship.limited_ad_tracking_ena.description: If true, the user has enabled limited ad tracking.

ios_channel.description: The identifier for an iOS channel. In general, this is also the same value as the "channel"

named_user_id.description: the named user identifier for the device.

device.title: App Device Information

id.description: Uniquely identifies an event. The data stream will occasionally send duplicate events. Duplicate events will have the same `id`, `type`, `occurred`, `device`, and `body` values but different `offset` and `processed` values. You should use the `id` to deduplicate.

offset.description: An identifier of a location in the stream; used to resume the stream after severing a connection. If you open a stream using the offset value, the stream will resume with the next element in the stream. You should store this value as a string so that you can easily resume the stream if it ends for any reason.

processed.description: When the event was ingested by Airship. There may be some latency between when the event occurred, and when it was processed.

title: Region Event
